schema.bodyLocation: Subcutaneous injection (abdomen, thigh, or upper arm)
schema.howPerformed: After comprehensive health screening and lab work, you receive a prescription for GLP-1 medication that helps reset hunger signals. You learn to self-inject once weekly using a tiny pen needle (similar to diabetic insulin, but just once a week). We start with a very low dose and gradually increase to minimize side effects. Weekly virtual check-ins and monthly in-person visits keep you supported, motivated, and medically safe
schema.preparation: Complete blood work (HbA1c, thyroid, lipids, liver function) before starting. Honest conversation about eating patterns, stress, sleep, and weight history. Set realistic goals—this isn't a quick fix but a sustainable reset. Clear your fridge of trigger foods and stock up on high-protein, nutrient-dense options. Download our tracking app and join the support group chat
schema.followup: Weekly virtual check-ins to adjust dose, discuss side effects, and celebrate wins. Monthly clinic visits for body composition scans, blood pressure, and in-person support. Nutritionist guidance on protein pacing, mindful eating, and meal prep. We track not just weight but energy, mood, sleep, and how clothes fit. After 12-24 weeks, we taper medication slowly while reinforcing habits that keep weight off
schema.outcome: Gradual, sustainable fat loss—typically 10-20% of body weight over 12-24 weeks. Hunger and cravings calm down dramatically. Energy increases. Blood sugar, blood pressure, and cholesterol often improve. You develop a healthier relationship with food. The weight loss feels manageable, not miserable. Many patients maintain results long-term by continuing lifestyle changes even after medication stops
schema.medicationRequired: GLP-1 receptor agonist (such as semaglutide or similar medications) via weekly subcutaneous injection. Optional supplements for digestion and hydration
schema.treatmentFrequency: Weekly self-injections for 12-24 weeks, with dose adjustments every 4 weeks based on tolerance and progress. After initial weight loss, some patients continue a maintenance dose, while others transition off medication with ongoing lifestyle support
schema.adverseOutcome: Nausea, especially in first few weeks (usually mild and temporary). Occasional constipation or diarrhea. Reduced appetite (desired effect, but can feel unusual at first). Fatigue if not eating enough protein. Very rarely, gallbladder issues or pancreatitis (we monitor closely)
contraindication: Personal or family history of thyroid cancer
History of eating disorders (requires careful assessment)

description: Drawing inspiration from our legacy site, this programme blends GLP-1 medication, mindset coaching, and nutritional guidance to create sustainable fat loss.

faq.question: Which weight loss medications do you prescribe?
faq.answer: We prescribe licensed GLP-1 receptor agonists (like semaglutide) and related metabolic medications that best suit your medical history. We only prescribe after thorough health screening and lab work.

faq.question: How much does medical weight loss cost in London?
faq.answer: Programmes start from £1,200 for a 12-week plan including medication, consultations, body composition scans, and nutritionist support. Medication costs vary based on dosing. 0% finance available.

faq.question: How much weight will I lose?
faq.answer: Most patients lose 10-20% of body weight over 12-24 weeks. Results vary based on starting weight, adherence, and lifestyle factors. We focus on sustainable loss—typically 1-2 lbs per week after the initial adjustment period.

faq.question: Will I regain weight after stopping medication?
faq.answer: Our focus on nutrition therapy, gentle movement, and nervous system tools helps you maintain results even as medication is tapered. We never just 'stop'—we transition carefully while reinforcing sustainable habits.

faq.question: What are the side effects of weight loss medication?
faq.answer: Common side effects include nausea (usually mild and temporary), reduced appetite, and occasional constipation. We start with low doses and increase gradually to minimize side effects. Most people tolerate medication well.

faq.question: Is medical weight loss safe?
faq.answer: Yes, when properly supervised. We require comprehensive blood work, monitor vitals regularly, and adjust doses carefully. GLP-1 medications have been extensively studied and are FDA/MHRA approved for weight management.

faq.question: Can I start the programme remotely?
faq.answer: Initial consultations can happen virtually and medication can be couriered to you. However, we recommend periodic in-person visits for body composition scans and thorough check-ups.

faq.question: How long do I need to take weight loss medication?
faq.answer: Typical programmes run 12-24 weeks. Some patients continue a maintenance dose long-term, while others successfully transition off medication with ongoing lifestyle support. We tailor the approach to your goals and progress.

You receive written protocols, WhatsApp accountability, and a cheering section when milestones are reached.
